A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
This is not the Star Wars movie you're looking for.  I bought tickets in advance\, waited in line with my kids to get good seats\, and felt joy seeing the title sequence and fan fare fill the theater.

What I ended up watching proved to be at best\, a missed opportunity to leverage the incredible cast Abram's put together in The Force Awakens\, and at worst a giant mess of a story.

First off the humor.  Sci Fi an humor go great together.  You can see what Guardian's of the Galaxy has done\, and what the Orville is attempting.  This movie felt like Disney pushed Johnson to make the movie more like Guardians.  Which isn't necessary\, and actually feels wedged in.

The actual story structure is bizarre\, as it bounces about having the heroes dance around in pointless efforts.  Whether it's Poe leading a mutiny against a Vice Admiral\, when all she needed to do was fill him in on her plan (given the decimated ranks of Rebel leadership\, it was the least she could do)\, or Finn running off to Canto Bight for no damn reason.

ugh...sorry.  It's just a mess.  Some people love it\, I'm glad.  But let's be honest\, this move would be a joke if it wasn't for the Star Wars halo surrounding it.

People WANT to love it\, so they ignore the bad writing\, and poor story plotting.

I recommend waiting to see this at home.  It's a long and dull movie.  

sigh
